relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
I have never encountered any problems.
I don't participate in any of the clubs on campus.
The sixth and eighth floor have couches.

The semester cost isn't too bad, even though it could be better. I wish the school did more for commuting students like helping out with subway fares and LIRR fares. It is extremely expensive to commute every month.
I commute everyday so once classes are over I am usually rushing to go catch the next train.
The new cafeteria that has just been finished being built is beautiful. There is also a wide variety of food to chose from.
There is a strong competition to excel over your classmates. It is very important to study in order to do well in the classes.
Apply early because there are many applicants each year.

John Jay college of Criminal Justice has been a great transfer choice for me in this first semester. The teachers have been incredible for the most part. I am very enthusiastic that they have included a Fire Science major into their curriculum.
pageTitle: CUNY John Jay College of Criminal Justice Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {225769=I am a transfer student that will be attending John Jay in the fall of 2013 and John Jay professionals have been very welcoming. I have attended several events the college has offered transfer students. textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students People who have alot going on. There are alot of people willing to help but you have to ask. they dont come looking for you. Tips for prospective students Always register early, and stay in contact with all your professors many of them teach several different classes and a good relationship can really help your grades. Bang for the buck Easy to get money help Am enjoying being here Great people, but there are some lazy people who just want their edu handed to them.stay away. Am learning a lot You get out what you put in. So many great teachers go to ratemyprofessors.com Login to rate or flag the reviews Priscilla from Kissimmee, FL 01/25/2011 Reviewer is A past student here. 13 out of 13 people found this review useful. 4 of 71
